<rule id="apm-00001" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <or>
                    <project>
                        <artifact artifactId="{*}" groupId="{*}newrelic{*}"/>
                    </project>
                    <file filename="newrelic{*}.jar"/>
                </or>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Application Performance Management (APM) tool - New Relic">
                    <message>
                        To migrate a Java application that uses New Relic to Azure, you can follow this recommendation:

                        * **Configure New Relic**: Connect New Relic with Java applications deployed on Azure by Azure portal or Azure CLI. For a detailed guide, please refer to the following documentation links.
                    </message>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/configure-language-java#configure-new-relic" title="Configure New Relic for Azure App Service"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/spring-apps/how-to-new-relic-monitor" title="Configure New Relic for Azure Spring Apps"/>
                </hint>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">New Relic</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>
